html:
** Morgan Stanley raises Amazon.com's AMZN.O PT to $4,200 from $4,000

** Brokerage says it expects accelerating North America retail and lower labor/supply pressures leading to better profitability and more investor conviction in AMZN's long-term share story in 2022

** Adds that improved disclosure into AMZN's estimated ~$19 bln spent on engineers per year (excluding Amazon Web Services) and emerging projects could help investors understand health of its core retail business

** "With AMZN now having lagged GOOGL/FB/MSFT/AAPL by anywhere from ~27% to 77% over the past 18 months due to concerns about decelerating growth, retail share loss...improved disclosure could be a positive (and needed) catalyst" - MS

** Estimates AMZN has roughly same number of engineers (ex-AWS) as Meta's FB.O total headcount and ~4.3x larger than total headcount of Snap Inc SNAP.K, Pinterest PINS.K and Twitter TWTR.K combined

** AMZN shares inch up 1% premarket; added 2% last year versus Microsoft's MSFT.O gain of 51%, Apple's AAPL.O 34%, Meta's FB.O 23%


(Reporting by Anisha Sircar in Bengaluru)

(( Anisha.Sircar@thomsonreuters.com ;))
